snippet: Researchers are exploring the limits of friction in the design of tiny robots that can pull thousands of times their weight, wander like gecko lizards on vertical surfaces or mimic bats.
abstract: Team of researchers at Stanford University plan to present paper on microrobots at International Conference on Robotics and Automation in Stockholm in May; paper will describe group of six robots, weighing just 3.5 ounces each, that can pull car weighing some 3,900 pounds.
lead_paragraph: Researchers are exploring the limits of friction in the design of tiny robots that can pull thousands of times their weight, wander like gecko lizards on vertical surfaces or mimic bats.

headline.main: Modeled After Ants, Teams of Tiny Robots Can Move 2-Ton Car
headline.print_headline: Teams of Tiny Robots Can Move a 2-Ton Car
